meanings.definition: Lacking stylishness or neatness in appearance
meanings.sent1: Her outfit looked dowdyish with its old-fashioned design.
meanings.sent2: The old curtains in the room gave it a dowdyish feel.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she couldn't shake off the dowdyish look.
meanings.sent4: The room's dowdyish decor reminded him of his grandmother's house.
meanings.sent5: The dowdyish appearance of the car made it stand out in the sleek lineup.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of fashionable style or elegance
meanings.sent1: The dowdyish sweater she wore was comfortable but not trendy.
meanings.sent2: His dowdyish shoes clashed with the formal attire of the event.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her dowdyish hat was the latest fashion faux pas.
meanings.sent4: The dowdyish painting in the gallery seemed out of place among the modern art.
meanings.sent5: Despite the dowdyish appearance, she carried herself with confidence.
